Description: Fragment of lip, neck and sub-round handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with corn ear(?) or grape cluster symbol.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '2'. Name Aretaios (also written as Arataios). For the date see I. Nicolaou, Paphos V. The stamped amphora handles, 442. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum ABC 0030.17.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (143)
